snippet: The plan defers bringing the budget deficit within a European threshold until 2017, as Paris said that a more rapid shift would harm the economy.
lead_paragraph: The plan defers bringing the budget deficit within a European threshold until 2017, as Paris said that a more rapid shift would harm the economy.
abstract: French Pres Francois Hollande's cabinet presents budget blueprint designed to cut 50 billion euros, or $63 billion, in domestic spending over three years; refuses to implement cuts any faster than that, declaring independence from European Union's austerity-budget regime; move intensifies showdown between France and its main eurozone partners.

headline.main: France Produces a ‘No Austerity’ Budget, Defying E.U. Rules
headline.print_headline: France Offers Budget That Defies E.U. Rules

abstract: France's economic recovery will be much more fragile in 2014 than originally thought and government will not be able to meet targets for reducing deficit for at least another two years; French economy will expand at tepid 0.4 percent pace in 2014, well below 1.7 percent rate government forecast in 2013.
